ferc_filing_data.tariff_title: National Grid - Port Jefferson FERC Electric Tariff No. 1

record_data.record_title: National Grid-Port Jefferson FERC Electric Tariff No. 1
record_data.record_narrative_name: National Grid-Port Jefferson Energy Center LLC's Market-Based Rate Tariff
record_data.record_plain_text:
NATIONAL GRID-PORT JEFFERSON ENERGY CENTER LLC FERC ELECTRIC TARIFF NO. 1
1. Availability. National Grid-Port Jefferson Energy Center LLC ("Port Jefferson") makes available under this Tariff: (a) electric capacity and energy for wholesale sales to purchasers with whom Port Jefferson has contracted; (b) the following ancillary services: (1) PJM: Port Jefferson offers regulation and frequency response service, energy imbalance service, and operating reserve service (which includes spinning, 10-minute, and 30-minute reserves) for sale into the market administered by PJM Interconnection, L.L.C. ("PJM") and, where the PJM Open Access Transmission Tariff permits, the self-supply of these services to purchasers for a bilateral sale that is used to satisfy the ancillary services requirements of the PJM Office of Interconnection. (2) New York: Port Jefferson offers regulation and frequency response service, and operating reserve service (which include 10-minute non-synchronous, 30-minute operating reserves, 10-minute spinning reserves, and 10-minute non-spinning reserves) for sale to purchasers in the market administered by the New York Independent System Operator, Inc. (3) New England: Port Jefferson offers regulation and frequency response service (automatic generator control), and operating reserve service (which includes 10-minute spinning reserve, 10-minute non-spinning reserve, and 30-minute operating reserve service) to purchasers within the markets administered by the ISO New England, Inc. (c) third-party ancillary services: Seller offers Regulation and Frequency Response Service, Energy Imbalance Service, and Operating Reserve-Service (which includes spinning, 10-minute spinning and non-spinning, 10-minute non-synchronous, and 30-minute reserves). Sales will not include the following: (1) sales to an RTO or an ISO, i.e., where that entity has no ability to self-supply ancillary services but instead depends on third parties; and (2) sales to a traditional, franchised public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier, or sales where the underlying transmission service is on the system of the public utility affiliated with the third-party supplier. Sales of Operating Reserve-Spinning and Operating Reserve-Supplemental will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except where the Commission has granted authorization. Sales of Regulation and Frequency Response Service and Reactive Supply and Voltage Control Service will not include sales to a public utility that is purchasing ancillary services to satisfy its own open access transmission tariff requirements to offer ancillary services to its own customers, except at rates not to exceed the buying public utility transmission provider's OATT rate for the same service or where the Commission has granted authorization.
2. Applicability. This Tariff is applicable to all wholesale sales of electric capacity or energy and ancillary services specified in Paragraph 1. 3. Duration. This Tariff shall continue in effect until terminated or changed and such termination or change becomes effective in accordance with any applicable regulatory requirements. 4. Rates. All sales of capacity, energy, and ancillary services shall be made at rates established by agreement between the purchaser and Port Jefferson. 5. Other Terms and Conditions. All other terms and conditions shall be established by agreement between the purchaser and Port Jefferson. 6. Modifications. Port Jefferson may unilaterally apply to the Commission or other regulatory agency having jurisdiction for a modification of this Tariff under Section 205 of the Federal Power Act and the regulations promulgated under that Act. 7. Effective Date. This Tariff is effective on May 7, 2002.
8. Compliance with Commission Regulations. Port Jefferson shall comply with the provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, as applicable, and with any conditions the Commission imposes in its orders concerning Port Jefferson's market-based rate authority, including orders in which the Commission authorizes Port Jefferson to engage in affiliate sales under this Tariff or otherwise restricts or limits Port Jefferson's market-based rate authority. Failure to comply with the applicable provisions of 18 C.F.R. Part 35, Subpart H, and with any orders of the Commission concerning Port Jefferson's market-based rate authority, will constitute a violation of this Tariff. 9. Limitations and Exemptions Regarding Market-Based Rate Authority. N/A.
10. Seller Category. Port Jefferson is a Category 2 seller in the Northeast region, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a). Port Jefferson is a Category 1 seller in the Central, Northwest, Southeast, Southwest, and Southwest Power Pool regions, as defined in 18 CFR 35.36(a).
